snippet: With the euro’s future unclear, depositors seem to be moving money to the euro zone’s more prosperous countries, leading to slow runs on entire national banking systems.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column contends that, with the euro’s future unclear, depositors seem to be moving money to the euro zone’s more prosperous countries like Germany, leading to slow runs on entire national banking systems; observes some economists are waiting nervously to see if the rate of withdrawals spiraled upward in May.
lead_paragraph: With the euro’s future unclear, depositors seem to be moving money to the euro zone’s more prosperous countries, leading to slow runs on entire national banking systems.

headline.print_headline: Amid Uncertainty on Euro, Europeans Hedge Their Bets
headline.seo: European Bank Deposits Tell a Tale of Euro Uncertainty
headline.main: Amid Uncertainty on Euro, Europeans Hedge Their Bets
